message: I have a question to our PHP Developers here :) I'm sending Emails from php mail() and it's working good on my local but in our dedicated server is not working :S ... is there anyway i can include another script and use it to send mails?

data.message: Ahmed Raslan Waleed Raslan Abdallah Mohsen Ahmed Kamal any suggestion?
it's not that :S i think the hosting company is disabled php mail() function :S
i'm not sure if this will help but we are hosting our emails in different hosting (google Apps)
mafesh customer support aw knowledge-base t2dr t2ra feha?
Google Apps uses smtp.google.com as the smtp server
And you have to enable pop3 and imap from your mail settings with google apps
Thanks a lot guys i've used this: http://code.google.com/a/apache-extras.org/p/phpmailer/ and it's working good
just saw this post my friend, i wanted to help but it seems that u did it/ ;)
Ahmed Raslan wala yehemak ya 7obby walahy fi so2al 3andy :) yenfa3 be cURL 2a3mel hit 3ala service with 100 Multithread at the same time? if not then what do you recommend?
I need you to explain more, if u just want to hit u can use apache benchmark after u make sure that apache 2 is installed then use this command: ab -n 100 -c 100 [URL]
good luck ya sadaka, if u need any further help plz Skype me anytime
Thanks a lot man. and if i want to do it with php? can i use cURL multithread?
